articles.author: Tatiana Bautzer, Saeed Azhar
articles.description: Citigroup (C.N) CEO Jane Fraser announced a major management reorganizationon Wednesday that will result in more job cuts and give her more direct oversight over its businesses as she seeks to simplify the bank's structure.
articles.title: Citigroup CEO sets sweeping management changes, job cuts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: United Auto Workers (UAW) union President Shawn Fain said on Wednesday that progress is slow as talks continue with the Detroit Big Three automakers, just a day before four-year labor deals covering 146,000 U.S. workers are set to expire.
articles.title: UAW president: lot of work remaining to reach auto labor deals

articles.author: Echo Wang, Anirban Sen
articles.description: SoftBank Group Corp's (9984.T) chip designer Arm Holdings Plc (ARM.O) priced its U.S. initial public offering (IPO) at $51 per share on Wednesday afternoon at the top end of its indicated price range, people familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: SoftBank's Arm prices IPO at $51 per share -sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's electric vehicle (EV) industrial chain is highly competitive, Cui Dongshu, secretary general of the China Passenger Car Association, said on Thursday, urging the EU to take an objective view of the industry's development.
articles.title: Head of Chinese auto industry group urges EU be objective on China EVs

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Workers at Chevron's (CVX.N) two major liquefied natural gas (LNG) projects in Australia are set to begin total strikes for two weeks from Thursday, potentially disrupting output that accounts for more than 5% of global supply.
articles.title: Chevron Australia LNG workers set to begin two-week total strikes

articles.author: Francesco Canepa, Balazs Koranyi
articles.description: The European Central Bank is set to decide on Thursday whether to raise its key interest rate to a record peak in what should be its final step in the fight against inflation, or take a break as the economy deteriorates.
articles.title: ECB considers lifting rates to record high even as economy slows

articles.author: Arathy Somasekhar
articles.description: Oil prices edged higher on Thursday, after dipping slightly in the previous session, as markets refocused on expectations of tight crude supply for the rest of 2023.
articles.title: Oil prices tick up as markets zoom in on supply tightness

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Soo-Hyang Choi
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un and Russian President Vladimir Putin met for a rare summit on Wednesday at which they discussed military matters, the war in Ukraine and possible Russian help for the secretive state's satellite programme.
articles.title: Kim Jong Un meets Putin in Russia as missiles launch from North Korea

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: U.S. consumer prices increased by the most in 14 months in August as the cost of gasoline surged, but the annual rise in underlying inflation was the smallest in nearly two years, likely giving the Federal Reserve cover to leave interest rates unchanged next Wednesday.
articles.title: Gasoline lights up US consumer inflation; underlying trend steadily improving

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan is "not for sale", the island's foreign minister said in a stern rebuke to Elon Musk who asserted Taiwan was an integral part of China, as the billionaire again waded into the thorny issue relations between Beijing and Taipei.
articles.title: Taiwan blasts Elon Musk over latest China comments
